summary: background Rabbits are cecotrophic, hindgut-fermenters that rely heavily on their gastrointestinal microbiota for optimal digestion of plant-based diets. Dysbiosis is known to predispose rabbits to rabbit enteritis complex (REC), a major cause of morbidity and mortality. teobacteria (P = 0.02), Deinococcus-Thermus (P = 0.04), Armatimonadates (P = 0.003), and Actinobacteria (P = 0.03) forming significantly different proportions of the microbiota. only significant difference between those farms that routinely reported antimicrobial use and those that did not was in one unclassified Bacteroidetes (P 0.05)
